{"step_by_step_thinking": "Socio-economic indicators are measures that help define the socio-economic status of a person or area. They include factors like income, education, and occupation, as well as measures of health and housing. Literacy rate, life expectancy at birth, and housing are all socio-economic indicators as they can reflect the socio-economic conditions of a person or area. Family size, however, is not typically considered a socio-economic indicator as it does not directly reflect socio-economic conditions.", "answer_choice": "D"}
